intro: Leptorhynchos squamatus subsp. squamatus, commonly known as the smooth-leaved leptorhynchos, is a herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
